page.title: 03THE DOVER PATROL
page.content: Every year at Leathercote Point there is a service to commemorate those people who were killed in the Dover Patrol during the first and second World Wars.The obelisk was built in 1920,then in 1921 it was finally completed. It was unveiled by HRH the Prince of Wales on July 27th 1921.The people of St.Margaret's raised Â£15000 for the Memorial Fund and all the names of the people who lost their lives, are written in the book of remembrance which is in the Dover Town Hall. The memorial service has been held on the Point since 1919 and each year the villagers - Scouts,Guides,British Legion etc.pay their respects. This obelisk reminds us to remember those men and women who gave their lives for us in the Dover Patrol.
